intro: Narcissus radiiflorus subsp. poetarum, commonly known as the poet's daffodil, is a rare and ornamental member of the Amaryllidaceae family. It is characterized by its striking, radiating petals that resemble a sunburst, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in Mediterranean climates, preferring well-drained conditions. It blooms in early spring, producing fragrant, yellow flowers that are highly valued in horticulture. Due to its limited natural distribution and cultivation challenges, it is considered a specialty plant among bulb enthusiasts.
